meanings.sent1: The impreciseness of the map led us to take the wrong turn.
meanings.sent2: Her impreciseness in measurements caused the recipe to turn out wrong.
meanings.sent3: The impreciseness of his directions made us end up at the wrong party.
meanings.sent4: The impreciseness of the weather forecast left us unprepared for the storm.
meanings.sent5: The impreciseness of the clock made us late for the meeting.

meanings.definition: The quality of being vague or unclear.
meanings.sent1: The impreciseness of his answer left us confused.
meanings.sent2: The impreciseness of the instructions made it hard to assemble the furniture.
meanings.sent3: Her impreciseness about the party details made us unsure if we should attend.
meanings.sent4: The impreciseness of the painting gave it an abstract feel.
meanings.sent5: The impreciseness of the memory made it difficult to recall the exact details.
